rules.label: PK
rules.comment: Primary Key (constraint(s) : ${pkColumn.constraint.name}, column position in PK : ${pkColumn.position})

rules.label: UK
rules.rule: column.fullName IN uniqueContraints.columns AND NOT LABELLED 'PK'
rules.comment: Unique constraint indexed by ${uniqueContraints.columns[column.fullName].index.owner}.${uniqueContraints.columns[column.fullName].index.name} (position in index : #${index.columns[column.fullName].position})

rules.label: FK
rules.comment: Foreign Key constraint ${foreignKeys.columns[column.fullName].constraint.owner}.${foreignKeys.columns[column.fullName].constraint.name} (column position in FK : #${foreignKeys.columns[column.fullName].position})

rules.label: I
rules.rule: column.fullName IN index.columns AND NOT LABELLED 'PK' AND NOT LABELLED 'UK'
prefix:(column.shortName LIKE '(.*)_FK') AND NOT LABELLED 'FK' AND prefix.group1 IN tables.byShortName
rules.comment: Column ${column.shortName} ending with '_FK', is it a foreign key to ${prefix.group1} ?

rules.rule: column.fullName LIKE '.*_FK' AND NOT LABELLED 'FK' AND NOT LABELLED 'FK??'
rules.comment: Column name ${column.shortName} ending with '_FK', should it be declared as a Foreign Key ?

rules.rule: column.fullName IN foreignKeys.columns AND NOT LABELLED 'I'
rules.comment: ${column.shortName} is declared as a Foreign Key, but without any index. If the target tableis deleted/updated often, an index should be created for this column.
